study.lab_name: Key Laboratory of Carcinogenesis and Translational Research
study.lab_address: Key Laboratory of Carcinogenesis and Translational Research (Ministry of Education/Beijing), Laboratory of Genetics, Peking University Cancer Hospital & Institute, No. 52 Fucheng Road, Haidian District, Beijing 100142, P.R. China
study.submitted_by: Z. Chen, C. Zhang, Z. Lu, Y. Ke
study.grants: Natural Science Foundation of China (Grant No. 81321003), Beijing Municipal Science and Technology (Grant Nos Z151100001615022 and Z141100002114046
study.inclusion_exclusion_criteria: Patients with esophageal squamous cell carcinoma
study.study_title: T cell Beta chain repertoire analysis reveals intratumour heterogeneity of tumour-infiltrating lymphocytes in oesophageal squamous cell carcinoma

sample.tissue_processing: Tumour specimens and normal tissue were dissected by a pathologist  Peripheral blood was drawn within 1 h post‐operation into EDTA‐coated tubes  The specimens obtained were stored at −80 °C within 24 h post‐operation  DNA was extracted from the frozen tissues and blood cells using DNeasy Blood & Tissue Kit (Qiagen, Valencia, CA, USA), following the manufacturer's instructions
sample.sequencing_facility: Key Laboratory of Carcinogenesis and Translational Research
sample.cell_processing_protocol: DNA amplified by PCR and sequenced in duplicate
sample.biomaterial_provider: Key Laboratory of Carcinogenesis and Translational Research
sample.cell_isolation: DNA extracted using DNeasy Blood & Tissue Kit

data_processing.software_versions: SRA Toolkit 2.8.2-1, cutadapt 1.14, fastqc 0.11.5, pear 0.9.10, biopython 2.7.13, MiXCR v2.1.10
data_processing.data_processing_protocols: Adaptors and primers removed and mixcr annotation of quality filtered sequences
